message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,100,000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident it will be a valuable asset for your business. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your confidence in the product's value, but I was thinking more along the lines of $950,000. I believe it's a fair price considering the market value.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $950,000 is simply too low for me.  The product is worth significantly more than that. I'm willing to come down a bit further, but I need to stay closer to my initial offer. How about $1,050,000?  It's still a great price for you, and a fair compromise.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit far from my target price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I can only go up to $1,025,000. I believe that's a fair price for the product.

Bob, I'm willing to continue negotiating with you, but I'm not willing to go below $1,035,000. It's a fair price for both of us, and I'm confident that this product will bring you significant value.  I'm running out of time, so please consider this carefully.

I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not convinced that $1,035,000 is the right price. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers, so I'll offer $1,012,500. I believe that's a fair price for the product and I'm willing to make a deal at this point.

Bob, I'm starting to run out of time here.  I'm willing to come down to $1,020,000, but that's my final offer.  It's a fair price for both of us, and I'm confident this product will be a valuable addition to your business. Let me know your decision.

I understand you're running out of time, but I'm not willing to pay $1,020,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers, so I'll offer $1,005,000. I believe that's a fair price for the product and I'm willing to make a deal at this point.
